title: Spack built python does not link to ssl

labels.name: triage
labels.description: The issue needs to be prioritized

body:
Once a spack built python linked to an external openssl (the system wide one) is loaded (whether by itself or as a dependent or in a environment) spack commands fail. 

### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
sajid@LAPTOP-CDJT2P3R /m/c/U/sajid> which python3
/usr/bin/python3
sajid@LAPTOP-CDJT2P3R /m/c/U/sajid> spack find -lv python
==> 1 installed package
-- linux-ubuntu20.04-zen2 / gcc@9.3.0 ---------------------------
xvkj7ej python@3.8.6+bz2+ctypes+dbm~debug+libxml2+lzma~nis~optimizations+pic+pyexpat+pythoncmd+readline+shared+sqlite3+ssl~tix~tkinter~ucs4+uuid+zlib patches=0d98e93189bc278fbc37a50ed7f183bd8aaf249a8e1670a465f0db6bb4f8cf87
sajid@LAPTOP-CDJT2P3R /m/c/U/sajid> spack load /xvk
sajid@LAPTOP-CDJT2P3R /m/c/U/sajid> spack find --loaded
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/sajid/packages/spack/bin/spack", line 63, in <module>
    import spack.main  # noqa
  File "/home/sajid/packages/spack/lib/spack/spack/main.py", line 31, in <module>
    import spack.architecture
  File "/home/sajid/packages/spack/lib/spack/spack/architecture.py", line 69, in <module>
    import spack.compiler
  File "/home/sajid/packages/spack/lib/spack/spack/compiler.py", line 20, in <module>
    import spack.spec
  File "/home/sajid/packages/spack/lib/spack/spack/spec.py", line 105, in <module>
    import spack.repo
  File "/home/sajid/packages/spack/lib/spack/spack/repo.py", line 34, in <module>
    import spack.caches
  File "/home/sajid/packages/spack/lib/spack/spack/caches.py", line 15, in <module>
    import spack.fetch_strategy
  File "/home/sajid/packages/spack/lib/spack/spack/fetch_strategy.py", line 41, in <module>
    import spack.util.web as web_util
  File "/home/sajid/packages/spack/lib/spack/spack/util/web.py", line 15, in <module>
    import ssl
  File "/home/sajid/packages/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu20.04-zen2/gcc-9.3.0/python-3.8.6-xvkj7ejpc5ox2wb2zuiiszucpsy5h62q/lib/python3.8/ssl.py", line 98, in <module>
    import _ssl             # if we can't import it, let the error propagate
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named '_ssl'
sajid@LAPTOP-CDJT2P3R /m/c/U/sajid>
```

### Error Message
Stacktrace is as shown above.

### Information on your system

```
sajid@LAPTOP-CDJT2P3R ~/p/spack (develop)> git shortlog -n1
iarspider (1):
      Lhapdf extends python (#19398)

sajid@LAPTOP-CDJT2P3R ~/p/spack (develop)> spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.11.2-9270-d9bb90d06
* **Python:** 3.8.2
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu20.04-zen2
sajid@LAPTOP-CDJT2P3R ~/p/spack (develop)>
```

```
sajid@LAPTOP-CDJT2P3R ~> cat .spack/packages.yaml
packages:
  perl:
    externals:
    - spec: perl@5.30.0~cpanm+shared+threads
      prefix: /
  openssl:
    externals:
    - spec: openssl@1.1.1f
      prefix: /
  cmake:
    externals:
    - spec: cmake@3.16.3
      prefix: /
sajid@LAPTOP-CDJT2P3R ~>
```

```
sajid@LAPTOP-CDJT2P3R ~> cat .spack/linux/compilers.yaml
compilers:
- compiler:
    spec: gcc@9.3.0
    paths:
      cc: /usr/bin/gcc
      cxx: /usr/bin/g++
      f77: /usr/bin/gfortran
      fc: /usr/bin/gfortran
    flags: {}
    operating_system: ubuntu20.04
    target: x86_64
    modules: []
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
- compiler:
    spec: 'clang@11.0.0

      Target:'
    paths:
      cc: /home/sajid/packages/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu20.04-zen2/gcc-9.3.0/llvm-11.0.0-rvxghsel3dq2v35ynccuo5jjkfrokxlr/bin/clang
      cxx: /home/sajid/packages/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu20.04-zen2/gcc-9.3.0/llvm-11.0.0-rvxghsel3dq2v35ynccuo5jjkfrokxlr/bin/clang++
      f77:
      fc:
    flags: {}
    operating_system: ubuntu20.04
    target: x86_64
    modules: []
    environment: {}
    extra_rpaths: []
sajid@LAPTOP-CDJT2P3R ~>
```

### Additional information

<!-- These boxes can be checked by replacing [ ] with [x] or by clicking them after submitting the issue. -->
- [x] I have run `spack debug report` and reported the version of Spack/Python/Platform
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
- [x] I have run the failing commands in debug mode and reported the output

Related https://github.com/spack/spack/issues/13902

PS : I've seen this bug on multiple platforms recently.

PPS : `spack load llvm && spack compiler find` for a spack built `llvm` gives an erroneous entry in `compilers.yaml` (see the above for clang's `spec`). Is this a known bug ?

<!-- We encourage you to try, as much as possible, to reduce your problem to the minimal example that still reproduces the issue. That would help us a lot in fixing it quickly and effectively!

If you want to ask a question about the tool (how to use it, what it can currently do, etc.), try the `#general` channel on our Slack first. We have a welcoming community and chances are you'll get your reply faster and without opening an issue.

Other than that, thanks for taking the time to contribute to Spack! -->
